title: Cuomo Faulted for Handling of Covid-19 in Nursing Homes by Most New Yorkers, Poll Shows
sub_head: The Marist poll comes amid criticism of how the state  delayed a fuller accounting of deaths at long-term-care facilities
body:
Six out of 10 New Yorkers say they believe Gov. Andrew Cuomo did something wrong in his handling of Covid-19 in the state’s nursing homes, according to a poll released Tuesday.
The poll by Marist College Institute for Public Opinion found the Democratic governor’s job-approval rating had slipped below 50%. Of the 953 adults surveyed Feb. 15 to 17, 49% said they approved and 44% said they disapproved of the job he is doing. The poll has a margin of error of plus or minus 3.8 percentage points.
“Cuomo’s approval rating, which was sky high in the summer, has returned to its pre-pandemic level,” Marist Poll Director Lee M. Miringoff said. “Should Cuomo decide to seek a fourth term, these results suggest it will be a challenge. That said, his current numbers are comparable to what they were when he faced the voters last time.”
It is the third poll released amid weeks of rising criticism of the way Mr. Cuomo’s administration delayed a fuller accounting of the number of New Yorkers who died at long-term-care facilities. Rich Azzopardi, a senior adviser to Mr. Cuomo, said the results varied between polls, and two other surveys showed the governor’s job approval above 50%.
“We remain focused on fighting this pandemic, administering as many vaccines as possible, and safely and smartly reopening our state,” Mr. Azzopardi said.
